name: logwood
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a tree in the bean family, used in the past to make dyes (= substances used for changing the colour of things) for cloth: Products obtained from logwood formed an important source of dyestuffs for silk and woollen cloth. Jamaica diversified into the production of export crops such as coffee, cocoa, logwood, bananas, and citrus.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the summer of 1658, £15,000 worth of logwood was seized by English customs off a Dutch vessel docked in London. Logwood dyestuffs were produced at the mill for more than 15 years.
